reviews.review: Even though this game is quite old, it is still a legendary game loved by many FPS fans. I personally find this Team Fortress instalment one of the best, including Team Fortress 2. However, the burning question is this game worth it? Well, let's put it like this; if you are into fast-paced FPS games like Fortress Forever, sure! However, before you play this game, I would recomend trying out Fortress Forever before trying Classic out. If you like the feel of Fortress Forever, you'll like Team Fortress Classic. It's a bit more difficult to figure out at first than TF2, but you'll eventualy get used to it. Overall, this is the best FPS out there.
this game is very good but i wish that this game had bots that would make it even cooler but anyway this game is better than tf2
10 minutes in; this game is already classic.

В начале я познакомился с TF2, она мне неочень то и понравилась из-за мультяшной графы.
Но я в неё начал играть и потом она прижилась.Ведь там много различных классов персонажей с разными способностями и кучей плюх.
Я заинтересовался: ведь если есть 2-ая часть, то есть и 1-ая.
Тоже самое было и с DOTA2, но сейчас не о ней...
Я посмотрел на ютубе про неё видео, и она мне сильно напомнила cs 1.6.
Я зашёл в стим и увидел эту игру за 129 (на тот момент) рублей.
Я быстро взял деньги, кинул на стим и купил эту игру, и когда я её запустил, я охренел...
Такое месиво на серверах и куча всего разного.
Те же, что и во 2--ой части персонажи, только с другим оружием и видом.
Разнообразные карты... И ещё больше плюх!!!
Короче: я подсел на TFC.
В общем игру я советую больше чем её вторую часть!!!
Обязательно покупайте и играйте, НО есть один минус: большенство серваков пусты!!!

Graficas arcaicas sin dudarlo pero es natural sabiendo la fecha de lanzamiento de este juego que de una manera u otra dio origen a Team Fortress 2 y que ahora es una verdadera joya.
Lo bueno es que practicamente cualquier maquina hace volar este juego, los requerimientos son minimos para la fecha actual, tiene compatibildiad con diversos SO y si eres amante de la saga de Half life encontraras que es muy parecido solo que con un modo de juego en linea.
Hablando del modo de juego en linea, desde este juego se veia lo bien programado que tenian la interaccion entre los diferentes jugadores, muy optimizado.
No hay mucho mas que agregar es un juego bastante simple que seguro le agradara a mas de un nostalgico, un juego que debes tener en tu coleccion.

TFC is not like it's illustrious sequel TF2 in many  ways.

The  menus can  be difficult to use.  A example of  this problem is when you change classes it can  sometimes tab out. This might be  due to settings on my computer so I am not saying it is a problem with  the  game.

The sniper in TFC  can be difficult to play as the cross hair is tiny.

Rocket jumping in TFC  is almost impossible as you will die from  the damage.

Spy is basically broken in TFC  the slow menus  and the  speed of  the  game don't  work  well.

Overall I  would not  recommend this game to  play, rather collect it for your steam library.

I'm  a  big  fan  of  TF2  and  to find  out  how  it began was actually kinda funny.

This game isnt dead whatsoever. You'll see at least 2 full servers per day. 

This game IS NOT like TF2, I repeat, NOT LIKE TF2. The only similarites between the two TF games are the classes and maps. Nothing else.

Grenades are very important on the battlefield.

This is a great game if you want to see TFC and enjoy the thrilling expirience.

In TF2, Spy isn't a relatively hard class to master , but in TFC, it is quite the opposite. No cloak, no instant disguise. However, It is rewarding seeing enemies splatter ang gib upon a backstab. Instead of a revolver, Spy gets a weak nailgun, a super shotgun, and a tranq pistol.

Other classes follow suit.

There's no fancy hats, different loadouts, or anything. Just plain default.

So, if that seems good for you, get TFC. If not, you can stick to Hat Simulator. ( still pretty fun )

If you are more familiar with TF2 like me... okay, if you started with TF2 like me then you'd have to be curious about Team Fortress Classic and well... it's just not worth it. It just doesn't hold up today, not for people like me.

I probably haven't played it for long enough of course, but do I have to? It's more fast paced sure, but more complicated. Over-complicated, even. It's unbalanced and the GoldSrc engine itself just has weird depth perception... Oh yeah, and nobody plays it anymore. I mean, there are barely any servers with human beings on it for me.

Yes, I know there are still people that like TFC, people that have been raised on TFC the same way I and many others were raised on TF2. And if you're one of them, good for you! That's fine with me. But I just don't like it myself. I'm going to stick with TF2. It's still much better balanced, more simple and it has hundreds of servers that people still play on today.

If you're curious to see what TFC looks like, then I won't stop you from getting it yourself. Just don't say I didn't warn you.

A very influential game for the genre, but also severely outdated and outclassed by TF2.

If you're in for a history lesson, why are you reading these reviews? You know you want to check it out, so go ahead and play it.

If you're expecting to have actual fun though, chances are you'll only meet grenade spam, a copious amount of round-stalling chokepoints on the maps and being pitted against some people who've been playing the game for almost 20 years non-stop.
Just go with Team Fortress 2 instead.

This is nice oldschool quake-like fps, but don't be confused with name, this isn't just older version of TF2, it's a different game with different set of rules, weapons and also quake-like maps.
You can try this game, but It won't be as catchy as TF2, simply because it's old and TF2 is kinda better(no offense to TFC players).
If you are familiar with Quake games, than you might play it little longer than others who don't.
But I think its time has past, so there aren't many servers and the game feels empty now.
Both TF2 and TFC are very good games and I encourage other gamers to play both.

Edit: Actualmente, el juego puede parecer estar muerto, ya que lo mejor encuentras algún servidor activo, pero seguramente si haya alguno, de todas maneras lo que recomiendo es que os descarguéis "FoxBot", son unos bots que funcionan en todos los mapas oficiales, además de que puedes añadir los que quieres con "addbot", pero que a lo que quiero llegar es que con estos bots bastante experimentados, puedes pasar una buena hora libre jugando en algún mapa con estos ^^

Edit muy importante: Este y muchos otros análisis que tengo están muy desactualizados, y en muchos me pasaba de lo que decía sin darme cuenta yo hasta ahora de las antiguas que eran las reviews mías, asi que perdonadme todos, un saludo.

Team Fortress Classic has nothing to do with Team Fortress 2. They are completely different games with different mechanics, although the classes seem similar.

General:
-TFC has grenades.
-Classes also have armor.
-Health Pool is different.
-Bhop is possible.
-While in TF2, the best gamemodes are Control Points, King of the Hill and Payload, in TFC it is actually Capture the Flag.

Scout:
-In TFC, he is used for his speed to cap the flag, rarely fights.
-No double jump. Concussion grenades are used and they are way more powerful.
-No Scattergun, has only a weak shotgun and a Nailgun used against sentries.

Soldier:
-Soldier has normal grenades and nail grenades - which shoot nails in 360 degrees and deal damage.
-Has a normal weak shotgun and a more powerful one.

Pyro:
-No airblast.
-Flamethrower deals damage depending on the amount of armor the victim has.
-Has an Incendiary Cannon which acts as a Rocket Launcher, but sets enemies on fire.
-Has normal grenades and Napalm grenades - which set enemies on fire.

Demoman:
-No Stickybomb Launcher, replaced by the Pipebomb Launcher. Pipebombs don't stick to surface.
-The Grenade and Pipebomb Launcher share the same ammo pool.
-Has a single-barrel shotgun.
-Has a detpack which has the ability to clear obstacles and open new entrances.
-Has normal grenades and MIRV ones - they split into smaller grenades which explode.

Heavy:
-Has 2 shotguns.
-Also has MIRV grenades.

Engineer:
-Cannot pick-up buildings.
-Has powerful EMP grenades which blow up the enemy's ammo and cause damage.

Medic:
-Medic is also used for capping flags because of his speed and concussion jumping ability, but is more powerful than Scout.
-Can infect classes with his medpack.
-No Medigun therefore no Ubercharge.
-His super nailgun is good against sentry guns.

Sniper:
-Basically TF2 sniper with the Classic and grenades.

Spy:
-Has a Tranquilizer Gun.
-Has a shotgun.
-Can feign death. 
-Has Hallucination Grenades.

Civillian is the last class which is used in special gamemodes.

Teams are pit against each other where Red uses defensive classes to protect their flag from Blue, which use mainly Scouts and Medics to capture it.

The community is very small and there are only a couple of servers at a time, but the game is a classic and I recommend it.
I shot someone in the foot with a sniper rifle and got a headshot.
Fun.

I really wanted to like it, but it's just too archaic and weirdly designed. Some examples:

-Some options, like cursors, have to be changed out of game. I don't like the default cursor, and I don't want to jump through hoops to replace it. I understand that that's on me, but it still annoys me.
-Infenction.
-Why have friendly fire as an option when the game includes a class that can disguise as a teammate? I've only been able to get matches on servers that have it, and that annoys me. The lighting also makes it really hard to differentiate enemies from allies, leading to more frustration.

Other:
-Not a ton of players, unfortunately. There's plently, but not as many as I'd like.
-Some classes are just plain bad, and not worth playing from my point of view.

The Good:
-Weapon variety. There's a lot of cool weapons.
-General things, like engine and map design.
-Not as commercialized as the Hat Game, and the weapons are slightly more balanced as a result.

The game is quite fun, but I now know why it evolved the way it did. If you can get it in a pack with other games, it's worth it. Even at full price, I'd recommend it; just be prepared for a rough game that might annoy you if you're used to the super-polished TF2.

All of this is my opinion, and some of it might be completely wrong. This is just my perspective. As a scrub/derty casul, I'd just prefer playing the more polished game.

edit:
I can no longer recommend this game due to the lack of players during weekdays. Your best bet is playing it casually on weekends. You used to be able to have a decent time playing bots. But something went wrong. The bots most servers use have the difficulty ramped up way too high. The bots tend to mimic veteran players. They 1 shot you with grenades, and do the same thing to your sentry guns and dispensers. They can kill them in like 2-3 seconds when seeing a few pixels of the sentry guns. Most real players aren't even that sweaty. These are now bots from hell and i think its driving players away rather than making them wait in a lobby until it fills. If they adjusted the bot difficulty down to easy,lobbies would probably fill up faster or would even be tolerable playing solo. Most servers are like this and empty during weekdays not all. 
I will leave my old review below since it still kind of applies on weekends:
old review:
Lag? Not a problem. You and your enemies have higher health than your modern day twitch shooter. Also the netcode is amazing! You would probably have a smooth gameplay if you entered a lobby with 150+ ping anyways, so don't let your ping scare you. You will engage in actual gun battles, not a "who saw who first." Don't like being a slayer? no problem! you can sometimes run past enemeis throwing yourself at the objective with almost no penalty. You can use mic or text chat. There are a lot of buttons, but don't let this overwelm you! You mostly will just jump, shoot and throw a grenade. Pure FPS fun without all of the b.s. Highly reccomend it to anyone in the NTSC/EU regions (US/Canada/Mexico/UK etc. and my game time lol this is from steam using this steam account. I've been playing it since 2002 off and on (casually).
